content.description: There is a 5.9 and a 5.7 way to do this climb.  For the 5.9 go directly over the roof left of the second bolt.  Climb right of the second bolt to the ledge then up left and onto the arete to clip the third bolt at your waist for the 5.7 rating.  This route shares anchors with Interstellar(10b), and is located just to its right.

This is the next route right of Blue Steel(9).To me this is the most enjoyable route at the ramp routes.  Probably because it is fun to pull the nice roof with the convenient big jug on the lip.  Maybe a bit soft for the guidebook rating of 5.10b.  But then again I might just think that because I have done it so many times.
This is the first route on the left end of the wall. The crux is at the 2nd/3rd bolts. Head up and slightly right after the last bolt to shared anchors with Blue Steel.
This is a quality but very short crack line located about 100' upramp from Phantasmagorical.  The crack widens out and opens up near the top just before the anchor.
content.protection: Not much is needed, I usually use stoppers, some small cams, and I always place my #8 BD hex just before the crux section.  A two bolt anchor will greet you at the top.

content.description: Follows a flake line in a semicircle back to the ground. (See picture of Ramp Routes - South)
content.protection: Could place some gear behind the flake or alternatively solo climb the route.

content.description: Oldschool 5.9!  Enjoy it and find the hidden buckets between technical sections.  Move left after the overhang and follow the crack as it changes size and directions.
content.protection: Bring small stuff up to a BD #0.75.  The gear can be tricky.
content.location: Start is the same as Alienation Effect.  Locate the runout face about 20 feet to the left of FDR's dihedral, just uphill from Interstellar.

content.description: This route shares anchors, and starts a few feet to the right of Homecoming Princess.  Clip bolts on your way over the two small overhanging sections.

Start on the runout face just to the left of FDR.  Pull a small bulge and start working to the right.  Use the crack and face features through these simultaneously delicate and powerful moves, finally reaching a glory jug marking the end of the route.  Scramble an additional 15 feet to anchors.  Shares anchors with Catharsis.
content.protection: Trad gear; small stuff!  Hard to work with.
content.location: 15 yards uphill from Interstellar.  Starts 20 feet to the left of FDR's dihedral on a runout face.
